X-Monitoring
Getting Started Components and Properties Tutorials

Components and Properties

It describes about common properties and the property of each component.

Common Properties

It describes about common properties of component.

Text Area

It describes the property about text and area.

  1. ID: Set component ID.
  2. Class: Set the class of component.
  3. Text: Specify the text of component. It can be entered even if double click the corresponding component.
  4. Text format: Set the format of text.
    • # : Numeric format (If the value or the value of the decimal is 0, it will not be displayed.)
    • 0 : Numeric format.
    • , : The expression of digit number.
    • . : The expression of decimal.
  5. Hide: Hide the component.
  6. Position Fixing: Fix the position of the component.
  7. Size
    • Width: Set the width of component.
    • Height: Set the height of component.
    • Rotation: Rotate the component. (If a positive number, it will rotate in a clockwise direction, and if a negative number, it will rotate in a counterclockwise direction.)
  8. Text box
    • : Set the horizontal alignment. (It is align left, center, align right, justify in order from left.)
    • : Set the vertical alignment. (It is align top, center, align bottom in order from left.)
    • The line feed of text: When the text is beyond the area of component, it will select whether to feed out the text.
    • : Set the top, bottom, left and right margins of text.

Style

The window in which can set the style property of component. It describes about the style property.

  • Transparency: Set the transparency of component. (0 ~ 1, 0: Invisible, 1: Visible)
  • Text style
    • Font: Set the font of component text.
    • Font size: Set the size of component text.
    • Line spacing: Set the line spacing of component text.
    • Color: Set the color of component text.
    • Bold: Set the text of component bold.
    • Italic: Set the text of component italic.
  • Fill style
    • No Fill: Clear the background.
    • Solid: Fill the background with a solid color.
    • Gradient: Apply the gradient to background.
      • Type: Linear Gradient (Shade from one color to another along a line), Radial Gradient (Shade one interior color and the other exterior color along a circular pattern)
      • Rotation: Rotate the background by the set angle.
      • Direction: Can select a background of a desired angle (increase/decrease by 45 degrees) from the dropdown list.
      • Color stop: It is a color wheel that specifies the color on both sides of the gradient slider.
    • Pattern: Insert the image as pattern.
      • Image: Select the image in the file store.
      • Align: Align Left Top, Top, Right Top, Left, Center, Right, Left Bottom, Bottom, Right Bottom.
      • Offset X: Move the entire background horizontally by a certain value from the starting point.
      • Offset Y: Move the entire background vertically by a certain value from the starting point.
      • Width: Set the width of each single image inserted as a pattern.
      • Height: Set the height of each single image inserted as a pattern.
      • Fit: Set the single image inserted as a pattern to the background of the scene.
  • The line style
    • Thickness: Set the thickness of line.
    • Color: Set the color of line.
    • Line style: Set the line style. (Straight line, dotted line)
    • Line end style: Set the line end style. (Square, round)
    • Lined style: Set the style of point where lines are connected.
      (miter : , round : , bevel : )
    • Start shape: Set the start shape of line.
    • Start size: Set the start size of line.
    • End shape: Set the end shape of line.
    • End size: Set the end size of line.

Effect

The window which can control the effect of component. You can add shadow effect in component or define animation and click event which will run in monitoring mode.

  • Shadow

    Set the shadow effect of component. It can adjust the location, blurring effect and color of shadow.
    1. X, Y coordinates (Number) - Adjust the coordinates for a location of shadow based on component.
    2. Size(Number) - Adjust the blurring effect of shadow.
    3. Color(Number) - Adjust the color of shadow.

  • Retention
    The length of time that the component remains on the board. That is, when the retention ends, the component disappears from the board.
    However, when a change occurs in the component property within the retention, the moment of the retention will be reset.

  • Animation

    You can set the animations of component which will run when converts to preview and monitoring mode.
    • Event point
      1. onCreate - Operate animation from the moment of running view mode.
      2. onChange - Operate when the data of component has been changed.
    • Animation type
      1. Rotation-CW
      2. Rotation-CWW
      3. Vibration
      4. Hearbeat
      5. Moving-Right
      6. Moving-Left
      7. Moving-Bottom
      8. Moving-Top
      9. Outline
  • Hover event
    Set the event which will be fired when the cursor of mouse is over the component. After creating the variable, set the variable and the value of variable which will be changed when the mouse is over the component.
    • Highlight - Highlight the border when the cursor of mouse is over the component.
      (When checked, the mouse event will also be applied in ‘tab event’.)
    • Variable information - Select the variable which will change the value when the cursor of mouse is over the component.
    • Value - Change the value of selected variable when the cursor of mouse is over the component.
  • Tab event
    Set the event which will be fired when the component is clicked. It basically provides ‘GoTo’, ‘Link Open’, ‘Link Move’, and can set the variable and the value of variable which will be changed when the component is clicked after the user additionally creating variable.
    (If want to fire a highlight event when the mouse is over the component, you can select ‘highlight’ of ‘hover event’.)
    • Variable information - Select the variable which will change the value when the component is selected.
      1. GoTo - Move to the screen of the corresponding SCENE.
      2. StopPlaying -
      3. LinkOpen - Open the corresponding URL in a new window.
      4. LinkMove - Move to the corresponding URL.
      5. InfoWindow -
      6. (Component variable) – The data of component.
    • Value – Change the value of selected variable when the component is clicked.

Line Component

It describes about the line component.

Straight Line

A common straight line.

  • Category : Line

Dotted Line

Straight dotted line.

  • Category : Line

Arrow

A straight line with an arrow on one end.

  • Category : Line

Double Arrow

A straight line with an arrow on both ends.

  • Category : Line

Polyline

A continuous line composed of one or more line segments.

  • Category : Line

Right Angled Path

Right-angled path.

  • Category : Line
  • Property :
    1. direction(Select) - Change the direction of the start and end.

Shape Component

It describes about the shape component.

Rectangle

The shape of basic rectangle.

  • Category : Shape
  • Property :
    1. Round(Number) - Round the edges.

Top Rounded Rectangle

A rectangle of which top edge is rounded.

  • Category : Shape
  • Property :
    1. round(Number) - Round the top edge.

Ellipse

Circle (including ellipse)

  • Category : Shape

Donut

Ring-shaped (donut shape)

  • Category : Shape
  • Property :
    1. ratio(Number) - Adjust the size of inner circle.

Triangle

Triangle

  • Category : Shape

Polygon

Polygon

  • Category : Shape

Star

The shape of star.

  • Category : Shape
  • Property :
    1. ratio(Number) - Adjust the thickness of shape.
    2. wing(Number) - Adjust the number of wing.

Marker

The shape of indicator.

  • Category : Shape
  • Property :
    1. innerCircleFillStyle(Color) - Specify the color of inner space of marker.

Text And Media Component

It describes about the text and media component.

Text


Text box

  • Category : Text

Color Image


Upload an RGB (Color) image.

  • Category : Media

Gray Image


Upload a Gray image.

  • Category : Media

Chart And Gauge Component

It helps the user understand data by displaying complicated data in the form of graph.

Common Property Of Chart

  • Category : Chart
  • Property :
    1. Theme(Select) - Change the theme of chart. Support ‘light’ and ‘dark’.
    2. Legend(Check) - Display the legend of chart. You can arrange in four directions like up, down, left and right.
    3. Text Size(Number) - Adjust the text size of chart.
    4. Value-Display(Check) - Display the value label in each field of chart data.
    5. Value-Display-Color(Color) - Change the color of chart value label.
    6. Value-Display-Size(Number) - Change the size of chart value label.

Bar Chart

The chart which displays the data in the form of bar. You can display with parallel bars or cumulative bars when there are several fields.

  • Category : Chart
  • Property :
    1. Stacked(Check) - Change the chart to cumulative bars.
    2. Multi Axes(Check) - Use the secondary axis of the chart. You should change the direction of ‘Target Axis’ of ‘Series’ as Right when use the data of secondary axis.
    3. Data Key - Series(String) - The field name of data which will be represented by the chart. Enter the field name of data which will be represented in Y axis. When display the data as below, Data-Key of Series will become ‘Good’ and ‘Bad’.
    4. Label(String) - The value of data which will be displayed in the legend.
    5. Target Axis(Select) - Select the direction in which will display the data of series. When select right, it will follow the range of data presentation and should select ‘Multi Axes’ of common property.
    6. Prefix(String) - The string which will be written in front of the data being displayed when the mouse is over the chart.
    7. Suffix(String) - The string which will be written behind the data being displayed when the mouse is over the chart.
    8. Data Key - X Axis(String) - The field name of data which will be represented by the chart. Enter the field name of data which will be represented in X axis. When display the data as below, Data-Key of X-Axis will become ‘Date’.
    9. Thickness(Number) - The thickness of bar chart.
    10. Grid Line - X Axis(Check) - Display the scale mark of X axis.
    11. Display Tick - X Axis(Check) - Display the label of X axis.
    12. Min Auto - Y Axis(Check&Number) - Specify the minimum value of Y axis or display automatically.
    13. Max Auto - Y Axis(Check&Number) - Specify the maximum value of Y axis or display automatically.
    14. Grid Line - Y Axis(Check) - Display the scale mark of Y axis.
    15. Display Tick - Y Axis(Check) - Display the label of Y axis.

Horizontal Bar Chart

The chart which displays the data in the form of horizontal bar. You can display with parallel bars or cumulative bars when there are several fields.

  • Category : Chart
  • Property :
    < The same as the bar chart >

Line Chart

The chart which displays the data in the form of line. (Please refer to the bar chart about the duplicated property.)

  • Category : Chart
  • Property :
    1. Multi Axes(Check) - < The same as the bar chart >
    2. Data Key - Series(String) - < The same as the bar chart >
    3. Label(String) - < The same as the bar chart >
    4. Line Tension(Select) - Change the angle of line which displays the data smoothly or sharply.
    5. Border Color(Color) - Change the color of line.
    6. Border Width(Number) - Change the thickness of line.
    7. Fill(Color) - Paint the space in which has drawn the line.
    8. Background Color(Color) - The change of fill color when the property of line is ‘Fill’.
    9. Point Shape(Select) - The shape of chart which displays the data.
    10. Point Size(Number) - The size of chart which displays the data.
    11. Point Bg Color(Color) - Paint the shape which displays the data.
    12. Target Axis(Select) - < The same as the bar chart >
    13. Prefix(String) - < The same as the bar chart >
    14. Suffix(String) - < The same as the bar chart >
    15. Data Key - < The same as the bar chart >
    16. Thickness(Number) - < The same as the bar chart >
    17. Grid Line - < The same as the bar chart >
    18. Display Tick - < The same as the bar chart >
    19. Min Auto - < The same as the bar chart >
    20. Max Auto - < The same as the bar chart >
    21. Grid Line - < The same as the bar chart >
    22. Display Tick - < The same as the bar chart >

Mix Chart

The chart which displays the data in the form of mixed bars and lines. (The property of mixed chart is the same as bar and line chart.)

  • Category : Chart
  • Property :
    1. Chart Type(Select) - Select the form of chart between line and bar.

Radar Chart

The chart which displays the data in the form of radar. It displays the data of pie chart with several lines.

  • Category : Chart
  • Property :
    1. Data Key - Series(String) - The field which will be the value of data. When there is the data as below, ‘Data Key’ of ‘Series’ will become ‘Good’ and ‘Bad’.
    2. Data Key - Axis(String) - The field which will be the label of data. When there is the data as below, ‘Data Key’ of ‘Axes’ will become ‘Line’.


< The remaining property is the same as line chart >

Polar Chart

The chart which displays the data in the form of polar coordinates.

  • Category : Chart
  • Property :
    < The same as the pie chart >

Pie Chart

The chart which displays the data in the form of pie.

  • Category : Chart
  • Property :
    1. Data Key - Series(String) - The field which will be the value of data. When there is the data as below, ‘Data Key’ of ‘Series’ will become ‘Good’.
    2. Backgroud Color(Color) - The color of pie chart.
    3. Data Key - Axis(String) - The field which will be the label of data. When there is the data as below, ‘Data Key’ of ‘Axis’ will become ‘Line’.
    4. Prefix(String) - < The same as the bar chart >
    5. Suffix(String) - < The same as the bar chart >

Donut Chart

The chart which displays the data in the form of donut.

  • Category : Chart
  • Property :
    < The same as the pie chart >

Circular Gauge

  • Category: Gauge
  • Property:

    1. Value(Number) - The value of gauge.

    2. startValue - The start value of gauge.

    3. endValue - The end value of gauge.

    4. step - The tick interval of gauge.

    5. stepTextSize - The tick text size of gauge.

    6. subStep - The space between ticks of gauge.

    7. stepNeedleSize - The tick size of gauge.

    8. startAngle - The start angle of gauge. It increases clockwise based on the 12 o’clock position. If a negative value, it will be reverse direction.

    9. endAngle - The end angle of gauge. It increases clockwise based on the 12 o’clock position. If a negative value, it will be reverse direction.

    10. textFillStyle - The tick text color of gauge.

    11. needleFillStyle - The needle color of gauge.

    12. innerCircleFillStyle - The circle color of gauge needle.

    13. stepFillStyle - The needle color of gauge.

    14. colorStops - The color of each sector of gauge. You can add a sector by double clicking and delete it by dragging down the marker.

    15. showStartValue - Determine whether to display the start value of gauge.

    16. showEndValue - Determine whether to display the end value of gauge.

    17. showStepLine - Determine whether to display the tick of gauge.

    18. showStepText - Determine whether to display the tick value of gauge.

    19. showSubStep - Determine whether to display the minor tick of gauge.

    20. inText - Determine the location of tick value of gauge. (checked: inside, unchecked: outside)

Vertical Gauge


The component which displays the gauge with a vertical bar.

  • Category: Gauge
  • Property:

    1. Value(Number) - The value of gauge.

    2. startValue - The start value of gauge.

    3. endValue - The end value of gauge.

    4. step - The tick interval of gauge.

    5. stepTextSize - The tick text size of gauge.

    6. subStep - The space between ticks of gauge.

    7. stepNeedleSize - The tick size of gauge.

    8. textColor - The tick text color of gauge.

    9. needleFillStyle - The needle color of gauge.

    10. needleSize - The needle size of gauge.

    11. stepFillStyle - The tick color of gauge.

    12. colorStops - The color of each sector of gauge. You can add a sector by double clicking and delete it by dragging down the marker.

    13. showStartValue - Determine whether to display the start value of gauge.

    14. showEndValue - Determine whether to display the end value of gauge.

    15. showStepLine - Determine whether to display the tick of gauge.

    16. showStepText - Determine whether to display the tick value of gauge.

    17. showSubStep - Determine whether to display the minor tick of gauge.

Horizontal Gauge


The component which displays the gauge with a horizontal bar.

  • Category : Gauge
  • Property :
    < The same as the vertical gauge >

Vertical Progress Bar


The component which displays the progress with a vertical bar.

  • Category : Shape
  • Property :

    1. Value(Number) - The progress value of progress bar.

    2. BackgroundColor(Color) - The color in which progress is not filled.

Horizontal Progress Bar


The component which displays the progress with a horizontal bar.

  • Category : Shape
  • Property :

    1. Value(Number) - The progress value of progress bar.

    2. BackgroundColor(Color) - The color in which progress is not filled.

    3. reverse - Fill the progress in reverse direction.

Circular Progress Bar

  • Category : Shape
  • Property :

    1. Value(Number) - The progress value of progress bar.

    2. startAngle - The start angle of progress bar. It increases clockwise based on the 12 o’clock position. If a negative value, it will be reverse direction.

    3. endAngle - The end angle of progress bar. It increases clockwise based on the 12 o’clock position. If a negative value, it will be reverse direction.

    4. blankStrokeStyle - The color in which progress is not filled.

Table Component

It describes about the table component.

Table

The component which is used to display several data in the form of table.

  • Category : Table
  • Property(Table):
    1. Row & Column(Number) - Adjust the number of rows and columns.
    2. Cell Width & Height - If drag the red handler of table with mouse, you can adjust the size of each cell.
  • Property(Cell):
    1. Border Style - Change the thickness and color of border of the selected cell. After enter the style value, type the button of cell in which will apply it among .
    2. Border Type - Change the type of line of the selected cell. After select the border type, type the button of cell in which will apply it among .
      (!!Apply cell border and table border differently.)
    3. Merge Cells - Merge the selected cells. (Apply to the neighboring cells only)
    4. Split Cells - Unmerge the cells.
    5. Delete Row - Delete the selected row.
    6. Delete Column - Delete the selected column.
    7. Insert Above - Insert a new cell on the top of the selected cell.
    8. Insert Below - Insert a new cell on the bottom of the selected cell.
    9. Insert Left - Insert a new cell on the left of the selected cell.
    10. Insert Right - Insert a new cell on the right of the selected cell.
    11. Distribute Horizontally - Make the width of the selected columns be the same.
    12. Distribute Vertically - Make the height of the selected rows the same.
    13. Data Key - The field name of data header when mapping the data in table. DataKey must be entered as the field name rather than the number of column.
    14. Data Index - The location of data row when mapping the data in table. DataIndex makes the start number of data except the header as 0.

      When receive the data as in the above image, if want to display the data of ‘01-03’ of Date, you can enter DataKey = Date, DataIndex = 2.

3D Component

It describes about the 3D component.

3D Container


3D Container

  • Category : 3D

Warehouse Component

The component which is used in warehouse modeling.

Rack

The component which is used to display warehouse rack. It can apply the height and layer, and can give a unique ID number in each rack and layer.

  • Category : WareHouse
  • Property :
    1. Depth(Number) - The height of one layer when converted to 3D modeling.
    2. Shelves(Number) - The number of layer when converted to 3D modeling.
    3. Location Pattern(String) - The pattern which is defined when give a unique ID number in the location and layer of rack. Define the pattern of Z(Zone), S(Selection), U(Unit), Sh(Shelf) in {}.
    4. Zone(String) - The value of Zone which will be applied to the pattern.
    5. Selection(String) - The selection value which will be applied to the pattern.
    6. Unit(String) - The Unit value which will be applied to the pattern.
    7. Shelf Pattern(String) - The value of Shelf Pattern which will be applied to the pattern.
      # - Dynamically apply the number of layer.
      0 - Fix the number of digits of layers according to the number of 0. (ex. 0 = 0~9 / 00 = 00~99)

Other Component

It describes about the other components which are used in the modeling.

Analog Clock


Analog clock

  • Category : Shape

Digital Clock


The clock of text format.

  • Category: Shape
  • Property:
    1. time-format(YYYY-MM-DD HH:mm:ss) - Specify the time format.
    2. is-local-time(checkbox) - Local time (checked by default)
    3. utc - universal time coordinated (Should specify before uncheck is-local-time.)
